lines.text: Thanks for firing me, Mr. Wertheimer. Goodbye, you worms!
He's the greatest music publisher in Vienna!
Mark my words, young man, if it hasn't got the imprint of Hofbauer, it isn't even music.
The only composers I ever knew were fat little men with bald heads.
Don't forget to turn out the light.
I was just going to arrest her, don't you see how guilty she looks?
I wish my wife looked as guilty as that.
I don't care who sings this! Vienna will sing this!
Where you wanted to be, in the Vienna Woods, and it's only six o'clock in the morning, and you have a long and beautiful day ahead of you.
He must be full of marches after a revolution like this.
We don't have revolutions every day, thank Heaven.
You probably deserve him more than I do, but he's going with me.
Have you ever been on the Danube?
And the earth, and the blood of life itself is vanity.
Something difficult and honest had to be said, and it was just like you to say it.
Tell me, is there still anything about me that annoys you?
